article.title: Hawking Radiation and Deflection of Light from Rindler Modified Schwarzschild Black Hole

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 1 illustrate about the relationship between Hawking temperature (Tₕ) and Rindler acceleration (a) in the RMSBH geometry?
choices: Tₕ decreases linearly with increasing a.
Tₕ increases linearly with increasing a.
Tₕ remains constant regardless of the value of a.
Tₕ follows a complex, non-linear relationship with a.

multiple_choice_question.text: What physical quantity does Formula (9) represent in the context of the RMSBH?
choices: Surface gravity of the black hole.
Hawking temperature of the black hole.
Deflection angle of light near the black hole.

multiple_choice_question.text: What phenomenon does Formula (55) describe in the context of the RMSBH at the IR region?
choices: Hawking radiation of massive vector particles.
Gravitational lensing deflection angle of light.
Quantum tunneling rate of spin-1 particles.
Hydrodynamical behavior of the black hole.

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula (34) represents an alternative way to calculate what physical quantity in the context of the RMSBH?
choices: Surface area of the black hole.
Surface temperature of the black hole.
